visualization

class myutils.sith2.visualization.MoleculeViewer(atoms, alignment=None, axis=False)[source]
add_angle(atom1index, atom2index, atom3index, color=[0.5, 0.5, 0.5], n=0)[source]

Add an angle to between three atoms: atom1, atom2 and atom3 - with the vertex in the atom2

Parameters:

  • atom1index (int) – Indexes of the three atoms that defines the angle.

  • atom3index (atom2index and) – Indexes of the three atoms that defines the angle.

  • color (color list. Default all gray([0.5, 0.5, 0.5])) – RGB triplet.

  • n (int. Default 10) – number of intermedia points to add in the arc of the angle.

  • Output –

  • ====== –

  • system (Return the angles in the) –

add_axis(length=1, radius=0.1)[source]

Add xyz axis.

Parameters:

  • length (float) – indicates the length of the axis in the visualization. Default=1

  • radius (float) – thickness of the xyz axis

add_bond(atom1index, atom2index, color=None, radius=0.1)[source]

Add a bond between two atoms: atom1 and atom2

Parameters:

  • atom2index) (atom1index (and) – Indexes of the atoms to be connected according with g09 convention.

  • color (list. Default gray([0.5, 0.5, 0.5])) – RGB triplet.

  • radius (float. Default 0.1) – Radius of the bond.

  • Output –

  • ====== –

  • system (Return the bonds in the) –

add_bonds(atoms1indexes, atoms2indexes, colors=None, radii=None)[source]

Add a bond between each pair of atoms corresponding to two lists of atoms: atoms1 and atoms.

Parameters:

  • atom2index) (atom1index (and) – Indexes of the atoms to be connected according with g09 convention.

  • colors (list of color lists. Default all gray([0.5, 0.5, 0.5])) – RGB triplets for each of the bonds. It can be one a triplet in case of just one color in all bonds.

  • radii (float or list of floats. Default 0.1) – radius of each bond.

  • Output –

  • ====== –

  • system (Return the bonds in the) –

add_dihedral(atom1index, atom2index, atom3index, atom4index, color=None, n=0)[source]

Add an dihedral angle between four atoms: atom1, atom2, atom3 and atom4 - with the vertex in the midle of the atom 2 and 3

Parameters:

  • atom1index (int) – Indexes of the three atoms that defines the angle.

  • atom2index (int) – Indexes of the three atoms that defines the angle.

  • atom4index (atom3index and) – Indexes of the three atoms that defines the angle.

  • color (color list. Default all gray([0.5, 0.5, 0.5])) – RGB triplet.

  • n (int. Default 10) – number of intermedia points to add in the arc of the angle.

  • Output –

  • ====== –

  • angles (Return the dihedral) –

align_plane(vector)[source]

apply_trans(atoms, trans, indexes=None)[source]

Apply a transformation to all vector positions of the atoms object

intermedia_vectors(a, b, n)[source]

Define the intermedia arc dots between two vectors

Parameters:

  • a (arrays) – side vectors of the angles.

  • b (arrays) – side vectors of the angles.

  • n (int) – number of intermedia dots.

  • Output –

  • ====== –

  • vectors. (Return the intermedia vectors between two side) –

plot_arc(vertex, arcdots, color)[source]

Add an arc using triangles.

Parameters:

  • vertex (array) – center of the arc

  • arcdots (list of arrays) – vectors that define the points of the arc. These vectors must be defined respect the vertex.

  • Output –

  • ====== –

  • angle. (Return the triangles in the) –

  • Note (if atoms2 is None, all bonds with atoms1 will me removed.) –

  • None (If atoms1 and atoms2 are) –

  • are (all bonds in the structure) –

  • removed. –

class myutils.sith2.visualization.VisualizeEnergies(sith_info, idef=1, alignment=None, axis=False, background='#ffc', trajectory=False, **kwargs)[source]
add_dof(dof, color=None, n=5, radius=0.07)[source]

Add the degree of freedom to the molecule image

Parameters:

dof (tuple) – label of the degree of freedom according with g09 convention.

Example

i=(1, 2) means a bond between atoms 1 and 2 i=(1, 2, 3) means an angle between atoms 1, 2 and 3 i=(1, 2, 3, 4) means a dihedral angle between atoms 1, 2, 3 and 4

energies_all_dof(**kwargs)[source]

Add all DOF with a color scale that represents the distribution of energy according to the JEDI method.

Parameters:

energies_some_dof (optional kwargs for) –

energies_angles(**kwargs)[source]

Add the angles with a color scale that represents the distribution of energy according to the JEDI method.

Parameters:

energies_some_dof (optional kwargs for) –

energies_bonds(**kwargs)[source]

Add the bonds with a color scale that represents the distribution of energy according to the JEDI method.

Parameters:

energies_some_dof (optional kwargs for) –

energies_dihedrals(**kwargs)[source]

Add the dihedral angles with a color scale that represents the distribution of energy according to the JEDI method.

Parameters:

energies_some_dof (optional kwargs for) –

energies_some_dof(dofs, cmap=<matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object>, label='Energy [Ha]', labelsize=20, orientation='vertical', div=5, deci=2, width='700px', height='600px', **kwargs)[source]

Add the bonds with a color scale that represents the distribution of energy according to the JEDI method.

Parameters:

  • dofs (list of tuples.) – list of degrees of freedom defined according with g09 convention.

  • cmap (cmap. Default: mpl.cm.get_cmap("Blues")) – cmap used in the color bar.

  • label (str. Default: "Energy [a.u]") – label of the color bar.

  • labelsize (float.) – size of the label in the

  • orientation ("vertical" or "horizontal". Default: "vertical") – orientation of the color bar.

  • div (int. Default: 5) – number of colors in the colorbar.

show_bonds(**kwargs)[source]

Show the bonds in the molecule.

Notes

The color is not related with the JEDI method. It could be changed with the kwarg color=rgb list.

show_bonds_of_DOF(dof, unique=False, color=None)[source]

Show an specific dof.

Parameters:

  • dof (int.) – index in sith object that corresponds to the dof you want to show.

  • unique (Bool. default False.) – True if you want to remove all the other bonds and only keeping these ones.

  • color (list[int]*3. default R G B for angles, distances, dihedrals.) – color that you want to use in this dof.

show_dof(dofs, **kwargs)[source]

Show specific degrees of freedom.

Parameters:

dofs (list of tuples.) – list of degrees of freedom defined according with g09 convention.

Notes

The color is not related with the JEDI method. It could be changed with the kwarg color=rgb list.
